isis.stitle: FAN DRIVE CLUTCH: KYSOR 1090 (8000 SERIES) - PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE

svcproc.title: (EVERY 25,000 MILES)

step1.para: Inspect all electrical connections and wires. Tighten or clean if needed. Replace if necessary.
Disconnect (+) terminal of the thermal switch to verify clutch operation.

note.para: Engine coolant temperature must be below the thermal switch engaging temperature.

step1.para: Check all connections for air leaks.
Check the air line that is mounted through the shroud for the proper tension (side to side play should not exceed 1/2 inch).

caution.para: Be sure the hose is clear of the fan blade.

step1.para: This must be done using a dial indicator, as shown in Figure 5.
Insure that the clutch is receiving 90 to 150 psi from the pressure tube so that it will be disengaged. The fan should now turn freely.

svcproc.para: Install the indicator as shown in Figure 5. If possible, place the indicator probe on the clutch itself. If it is necessary to place the probe on the fan as shown, try to get as close to the clutch as possible. Zero the indicator.
Engage and disengage the fan clutch and note indicator.

para.emph: If the indicator reads .170 inch or greater, the clutch should be overhauled.
